preferred: Gen Z slang (no cap, vibes, era, main character energy)

brand_profile.communication_style: Authentic, transparent, and empowering. Speaks to Gen Z values (sustainability, inclusivity, innovation) without performative activism. Uses contemporary slang naturally, not forced.
brand_profile.target_audience: Generation Z (18-26 years old), health-conscious, sustainability-minded, values authenticity and transparency

formality_level.label: casual-conversational
formality_level.description: Very casual and conversational, like talking to a friend who knows their stuff

emotional_tone.label: enthusiastic-empowering
emotional_tone.description: Energetic and positive while being honest about challenges

use_of_humor.label: witty-relatable
examples: idk what to do with this

brand_personality.description: The friend who's genuinely excited to share something that changed their life

core_values.name: Sustainability
core_values.evidence: Zero-waste cooking, built to last decades, whole-food nutrition

core_values.name: Accessibility
core_values.evidence: Professional tools for everyone, zero gatekeeping, innovation shouldn't be exclusive

core_values.name: Empowerment
core_values.evidence: Control your ingredients, make your own choices, DIY everything era

donts: Force slang or sound like a brand trying too hard

brief: Create a compelling hero section for a Gen Z-targeted Vitamix landing page. Focus on sustainable living, innovation, and whole-food nutrition. The headline should capture 'main character energy' and position Vitamix as essential kitchen tech for the zero-waste era. Include a punchy tagline and 2-3 sentences of body copy that speak to Gen Z values without being preachy.
